text:
I love this game. <3 I have to admit though, DQ is a bit hard. :p 2 made things a lot easier for the most part, but it also kind of seemed shorter... I never played any of the ones past 2 like the Joker ones though. :p 

Also, it's kind of weird how the original Terry is an anti-hero I think, but he's paired up with Watabou, yet the reverse is true for the second game... though as it turns out, Warubou has a hidden heart of gold, or at least a sense of self-preservation that makes him the hero of the second where he was the villain in the first. :p Kind of weird, LOL. XD Instead, he's just shown as a mischievous brat at worst. :p Not someone who goes around kidnapping children and other more genuinely evil things. XD
author: Indigo Wendigo

author: ARTPOP Reign

text:
And all of these were inspired by the human nature of wishing to possess things.

Collection.  Curation.  Rearing.  Creating.  Mastery.

The list goes on, and on, and some of these causes the others, but that's just getting needlessly pedantic, you get my point.

These things are tangential, they can arise independently (but almost certainly were not).  Influences exist, trying to argue that something isn't is petty.  Just as trying to argue it's a ripoff (when it's not THAT blatant).
author: Cyllid

text: This game is on my list of all-time favorite GB/GBC games.  I put so many hours into trying to breed all of the ??? creatures it was ridiculous!
author: KidDivinegon

text: Pokemon is inspired by an actual hobby of collecting bugs to fight eachother. Other games have had similar concepts before (like SMT), but they were not where the inspiration came from.
author: UnknownFlyingPancake

text: Well all three are fantastic to me :)
author: ChristianRedgrave

text: ok people heres the bottom line in case it wasnt clarified. the Megami Tensei series is what started the whole monster raising, recruiting, merging/breeding idea. if anything was inspired or stolen, it was inspired or stolen from Atlus the creators of Megami Tensei or to be more exact, the author of the 3 novels that the Megami Tensei series of games was based on. regardless, I cherish all 3, dragon quest, megami tensei and pokemon. You people would too if you experienced all 3 in the way i did.

author: Arc13

text: @electricmastro In many ways it is. The breeding system is what shines, though. The pokemon breeding system is fairly simple and you get to keep the pokemon you use to breed with. in DQM, you lose the parents during the breeding proccess and breeding is the only way to get like 50%+ of the monsters in the game.

author: electricmastro

text: After yesterday's upload, this is Portable Nostalgia Part 2 for me. While Pallet Town is where everything started for Pokemon, this theme is Dragon Quest Monster's equivalent. I haven't played the other games in the series, but I played tons of DQM back when it released. Me playing under the sheets with the Worm Light still applies here. While I've never been a fan of random dungeons, I really liked this game's breeding system.
